 1. Maybe you can use your words like an adult and explain it to us.

 4. This report reached some conclusions. The first was
 
The first possibility-that the Epic account derived from the Genesis account-has been discounted in this research because of the dates of the extant copies of the Epic and Genesis. The original compilations of the Epic are older than the original compilations of Genesis.

 The reference you provided refuted your own statement. Perhaps you should read this stuff first. 
 5. The other conclusions were that the hypothesis that Genesis was based on the Sumerian epic could not be true because there were too many changes and Genesis is more "reliable". They conclude, conveniently, that both were based upon some common source which the Sumerians distorted and Moses got right. Those source materials do not exist, of course. Excellent scholarship. I guess the Creation Ministries pride themselves on their creativity.

 Hi moose, I did read the link before posting it. And I posted it anyway. You know why ? Because I'm not threatened by what we don't know. Answer me this, can you guarantee me that the oldest copy of Genesis that we have, that is just about 2 1/2 to 3 centuries younger than the Epic of Gilgamesh is the original copy of Genesis to have ever existed ? The huge assumptions you people are so happy to leap to as long as they support your perspective on history is enough to blow my mind.
 
 I freely admit that I don't have all the answers with such ancient knowledge and that I take much of what's in the Old Testament on faith based on my personal knowledge of the Author, but you have the same extraordinary faith in the Sumerians, a dead race, when the people of Israel, the very descendants of Abraham whom God promised to preserve in the book of Genesis, until the end of this Age are still here as is the entire book of Genesis compared to just one stone copy of the Epic. 
 
 There is so much extra evidence written of in genesis that has proven true yet you reject all of that in favor of an extinct sumerian cultures text. And you people call yourselves rational scientific minds who test the facts before determining the most reasonable results. If the results agree with your limited perspective then you gladly accept them. But if they conflict with your comfort zones then they must be false and mythical. 
 
 You are unable to separate yourself enough from the contradictions to make the obvious connection that if two provably Ancient Civilizations that are absolutely known to have existed at the very time frame being discussed and telling pretty much the precise same story, that the story is most likely if not absolutely beyond question TRUE. The only question then would be whose account is more accurate.
